data.title: aurora: Name Meaning, Origin, History, And Popularity
data.meta_description: With roots in Latin mythology and connection to the dawn, explore the eternal beauty of the name Aurora and why it continues to shine bright for new parents.
data.text:
In This Article

Origin, Meaning, And History Of Aurora

The name Aurora bears a rich history and has been used for centuries. Aurora is a dainty and feminine name originating from the Latin word meaning ‚Äúdawn.‚Äù Aurora was inspired by the diaphanous ancient Roman goddess of dawn whose tears were believed to turn into morning dew and were associated with light and the morning sky.

The name Aurora was later adopted by the Spanish, who used it to refer to the natural phenomenon of the Northern Lights. This name gradually became popular in the Western world during the 16th and 17th centuries. Over time, the name also started reaching other parts of the world, including Europe, and eventually made its way to the United States in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

Leaning into the mystic and ethereal essence of the name, Aurora invokes mystical images of the Aurora Borealis, the Northern Lights. Popular in Sweden, Spain, and Italy since the 17th century, Aurora was common in several European nations. Aurore, the French form, has been popular from the 1970s to 1980s, and Avrora in the Russian languages after the Russian Revolution of 1917.

Aurora has carried several variations, rich in history and meaning, such as Avrorka, Ava, Rory, Ara, and Avrora. The phonetic spelling of the name Aurora is ‚Äúah-more-uh.‚Äù In English, the stress is typically on the first syllable, and the name is pronounced with an ‚Äúa‚Äù sound, as in ‚Äúare‚Äù and ‚Äúore,‚Äù as in ‚Äúmore.‚Äù

There are many fictional characters named Aurora across different forms of media, including books, movies, and TV shows. One of the most well-known is Princess Aurora from Disney‚Äôs ‚ÄúSleeping Beauty,‚Äù a beautiful princess who falls under the spell of an evil fairy and is only awoken from her slumber by the kiss of her prince. Other popular Auroras include the titular character in the 2014 film ‚ÄúMaleficent,‚Äù and a character in the hit TV series ‚ÄúOnce Upon a Time.‚Äù The name Aurora is often associated with grace, beauty, and strength, making it a popular choice for fictional actors.

Aurora On The Popularity Chart

In recent years, the popularity of the name Aurora has seen a resurgence, and it is now a popular choice among parents in many English-speaking countries. Here is a graphic representation of the increase in popularity and ranking over time.

Popularity Over Time

Initially popular in Italy, Sweden, and Spain during the 17th century, Aurora has become a trendy baby name across Europe and the United States. Check out this graph depicting the popularity since the 1980s.

Source:

Rank Over Time

Aurora ranked 36th as a popular baby girl name in 2021. Explore how the name Aurora has changed in ranking through time by looking at the graph.

Source:

Aurora Name‚Äôs Presence On Social Media

Before you finalize your baby‚Äôs name, you would want to assess if the name is rare or popular. Digital footprint of the name - it‚Äôs presence on the internet and social media platforms - can provide you with valuable insights on it‚Äôs popularity. A name‚Äôs online presence is an important metric for new parents to evaluate their options and make an informed choice. How many people are searching the name on Google, how many profiles are there on Facebook, does the name have a Wikipedia page? Such information surely tells you if the name is ubiquitous or unique. Here is how Aurora fares on that count.

Aurora‚Äôs Zodiac Sign As Per Western Astrology

Western astrology includes the construction of a horoscope based on the person‚Äôs exact time of birth and location to understand the positions of the planet, stars, and zodiac signs at that time. However, in popular culture, it is often narrowed down to the sun sign, which depends on the person‚Äôs birth date.There are 12 zodiac signs, each having dominant traits, planetary rulers, elemental connection, and more.

Zodiac sign or Sun sign

The Earth‚Äôs orbit around the sun is divided into 12 zodiac signs covering 30-degree sectors. According to Western astrology, the zodiac or sun sign depends on the sun‚Äôs position in one of these sectors at the time of your birth. Starting from the sun‚Äôs position at the March equinox, the chart goes anti-clockwise from Aries, followed by Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, and Pisces. These signs are ruled by planetary bodies - Mars, Venus, Mercury, Moon, Sun, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Furthermore, they are categorized into triplicities or elemental signs - fire, water, air, and earth - that govern their characteristics. Each of these zodiac signs features certain personality traits that may determine how a person presents themselves.

Each zodiac sign in Western astrology is linked to a specific range of dates in the year. Unlike Vedic astrology, where names can sometimes be used to infer astrological details, Western astrology relies entirely on the birth date.

To know more about your baby‚Äôs zodiac sign, choose the period in which your baby‚Äôs date of birth falls, from the options given below. This will give you a glimpse into the world of astrology tailored for your baby.

Aurora‚Äôs Zodiac Sign And Birth Star As Per Vedic Astrology

Aurora Personality Traits As Per Numerology

The numerology belief system envisages a relationship between a name and numbers. The related numbers are believed to give insights into a person‚Äôs character. We have researched this area to connect the numerology-based characteristic traits to the letters of the English alphabet. And the results are fascinating.

Numerology followers believe that each letter signifies attributes that can influence a person‚Äôs attitude and approach. Among these placements, the most significant are the first letter (Cornerstone) and the last letter (Capstone) of a name. Cornerstone highlights your primary personality traits and explains how you face challenges and opportunities in life. Capstone can tell you about your approach to work and how you complete them. Often, a letter may be repeated twice or more in a name. This repetition signifies the intensification or amplification of the traits associated with the letter in an individual‚Äôs personality.

Read to know what characteristics the name Aurora is known for in numerology. Here we have avoided repetition of letters and added them just once for a better reading experience.

Infographic: Know The Name Aurora‚Äòs Personality As Per Numerology
